intro: Humboltia pedunculata, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the deserts of North America. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that produces yellow flowers with a distinctive cup-like shape. The plant has silver-green leaves covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and drought. Humboltia pedunculata plays an important ecological role by providing nectar for pollinators and shelter for small desert animals.
